contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox noble|type | name = Nyame | title = [[King of Heaven]],<br/>Progenitor of [[Litunga]]s | image = Gye nyame.png | caption = Symbol for Nyame | mother = Ngula | image_size = 130px | spouse = [[Asase Ya]]<br/>Nasilele<br/>Mwambwa <br/>Mbuymamwambwa<br/><ref>She was also a stepdaughter of Nyame.</ref> | spouse-type = Consorts | issue = Tano<br/>Bia<br/>[[Anansi]]<br/>[[Yeta I]]<br/>[[Mwanasolundwi Muyunda Mumbo wa Mulonga]]<br/>[[Inyambo]]<br/>[[Ingulamwa]]<br/>Apo<ref>God of waters.</ref><br/>Bosomtwe<ref>Also god of waters.</ref> }} '''Nyame''' (or '''Nyambe''', '''Nyankopon''') is the [[List of sky deities|Sky deity]] of the [[Akan people]] of [[Ghana]], the leader of the Abosom, the Akan [[spirit]]s and minor gods.<ref>{{cite book |title=Who's who in non-classical mythology |last= |first= |authorlink= |coauthors=Egerton Sykes, Alan Kendall |year=2001 |publisher=Routledge |location= |isbn=0-415-26040-X, 9780415260404 |page=144 |url=http://books.google.co.uk/books?id=xlRaVT1DOW8C&pg=PA146&dq=%22Ashanti+mythology%22&cd=1#v=onepage&q=Ashanti&f=false |accessdate=2010-05-24}}</ref> His name means "he who does not speak" in the [[Luyana language]].<ref>''The Lozi peoples of north-western Rhodesia'' by Victor Witter Turner</ref> == Function== He is called "king of the [[Lozi people]]" and [[Lozi mythology|it is said]] that he was a maker of animals, forests and birds.<ref>[http://www.royalark.net/Zambia/lozi2.htm Family tree of Litungas]</ref> Nyame is portrayed as a benevolent god, if sometime aloof and distant. The [[sun]] is his right eye, which he open during the day, while the [[moon]] is his left eye. One of Nyame's creations was Kamunu, the first human being. Nyame gave Kamunu the task of naming all the other creations.<ref>[http://www.sacred-texts.com/afr/mlb/mlb04.htm Origin of death]</ref><ref>[[Harold Scheub]], ''Nyambe And The Origin of Death''. A Dictionary of African Mythology, [[Oxford University Press]], 2000</ref> ==Family== Mother of Nyame was named Ngula. She was a goddess created by her own son. His divine wife is [[Asase Ya]], goddess of earth and fate and they have two children: Tano, [[river]] god of [[war]] and Bia, god of wild animals (he is also called ''Bea'').<ref>''African Mythology, A to Z'' by [[Patricia Ann Lynch]], [[Jeremy Roberts]]</ref> Also the son or servant and herald of Nyame is [[Anansi]], the Spider [[Trickster]] god, bringer of knowledge and stories.<ref>See [http://www.metmuseum.org/toah/ho/11/sfg/ho_1986.475a-c.htm#|this Ashanti linguist staff finial.]</ref> His mortal queens were Nasilele, Mwambwa and Mbuymamwambwa and his mortal sons were chiefs [[Yeta I]], [[Mwanasolundwi Muyunda Mumbo wa Mulonga]], [[Inyambo]] and [[Ingulamwa]].<ref>[http://www.royalark.net/Zambia/lozi2.htm Family tree of Litungas]</ref> After Nyame returned to heaven, Nasilele died a few weeks later. ==Nyame and Anansi== Nyame gave Anansi his stories in exchange for gifts, and then charged the spider-god to walk the world and find new stories. ==See also== *[[Nyambe Patera]] *[[Akan religion]] *[[West African Vodun]] ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Persondata | NAME = Nyame | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH = | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} [[Category:African gods]] [[Category:Sky and weather gods]] [[Category:Legendary progenitors]]
